meanings.definition: The quality or state of being quantitative.
meanings.sent1: Her research focused on the quantitativenesses of different data sets.
meanings.sent2: Scientists rely on the quantitativenesses of their experiments to draw conclusions.
meanings.sent3: The quantitativenesses of the ingredients in the recipe were crucial for its success.
meanings.sent4: In a world of opinions, she valued the quantitativenesses of facts.
meanings.sent5: The quantitativenesses of the measurements made the comparison clear.

meanings.definition: The property of having a measurable amount or quantity.
meanings.sent1: The quantitativenesses of the ingredients were essential for the recipe.
meanings.sent2: Supermarkets ensure the quantitativenesses of products for accurate pricing.
meanings.sent3: The quantitativenesses of the puzzle pieces made it easier to solve.
meanings.sent4: His love for music was evident in the quantitativenesses of his vinyl collection.
meanings.sent5: The quantitativenesses of the rainfall determined the severity of the flood.
